intro: Parosela campylostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parosela, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Parosela campylostachya is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands.
